channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: DeCrisisMB: Debiased Semi-Supervised Learning for Crisis Tweet Classification via Memory Bank
item.description: During crisis events, people often use social media platforms such as Twitter to disseminate information about the situation, warnings, advice, and support.

item.title: Novel-View Acoustic Synthesis from 3D Reconstructed Rooms
item.description: Given audio recordings from 2-4 microphones and the 3D geometry and material of a scene containing multiple unknown sound sources, we estimate the sound anywhere in the scene.

item.title: ESVAE: An Efficient Spiking Variational Autoencoder with Reparameterizable Poisson Spiking Sampling
item.description: In this paper, we propose an efficient spiking variational autoencoder (ESVAE) that constructs an interpretable latent space distribution and design a reparameterizable spiking sampling method.

item.title: Adam through a Second-Order Lens
item.description: Research into optimisation for deep learning is characterised by a tension between the computational efficiency of first-order, gradient-based methods (such as SGD and Adam) and the theoretical efficiency of second-order, curvature-based methods (such as quasi-Newton methods and K-FAC).

item.title: E4S: Fine-grained Face Swapping via Editing With Regional GAN Inversion
item.description: Based on this disentanglement, face swapping can be simplified as style and mask swapping.

item.title: NormDial: A Comparable Bilingual Synthetic Dialog Dataset for Modeling Social Norm Adherence and Violation
item.description: Social norms fundamentally shape interpersonal communication.

item.title: Bayesian Regression Markets
item.description: Machine learning tasks are vulnerable to the quality of data used as input.

item.title: GeoLM: Empowering Language Models for Geospatially Grounded Language Understanding
item.description: This paper introduces GeoLM, a geospatially grounded language model that enhances the understanding of geo-entities in natural language.

item.title: SpEL: Structured Prediction for Entity Linking
item.description: Entity linking is a prominent thread of research focused on structured data creation by linking spans of text to an ontology or knowledge source.

item.title: FD-Align: Feature Discrimination Alignment for Fine-tuning Pre-Trained Models in Few-Shot Learning
item.description: Due to the limited availability of data, existing few-shot learning methods trained from scratch fail to achieve satisfactory performance.

item.title: SAM-Med3D
item.description: These issues can hardly be addressed by fine-tuning SAM on medical data because the original 2D structure of SAM neglects 3D spatial information.

item.title: Zero123++: a Single Image to Consistent Multi-view Diffusion Base Model
item.description: We report Zero123++, an image-conditioned diffusion model for generating 3D-consistent multi-view images from a single input view.

item.title: DEsignBench: Exploring and Benchmarking DALL-E 3 for Imagining Visual Design
item.description: For DEsignBench benchmarking, we perform human evaluations on generated images in DEsignBench gallery, against the criteria of image-text alignment, visual aesthetic, and design creativity.

item.title: Text Fact Transfer
item.description: Text style transfer is a prominent task that aims to control the style of text without inherently changing its factual content.

item.title: Towards a Mechanistic Interpretation of Multi-Step Reasoning Capabilities of Language Models
item.description: We show that MechanisticProbe is able to detect the information of the reasoning tree from the model's attentions for most examples, suggesting that the LM indeed is going through a process of multi-step reasoning within its architecture in many cases.

item.title: Large Language Models can Share Images, Too!
item.description: To our knowledge, this is the first study to assess the image-sharing ability of LLMs in a zero-shot setting without visual foundation models.

item.title: RoboDepth: Robust Out-of-Distribution Depth Estimation under Corruptions
item.description: Depth estimation from monocular images is pivotal for real-world visual perception systems.

item.title: Practical Deep Dispersed Watermarking with Synchronization and Fusion
item.description: Compared with state-of-the-art approaches, our blind watermarking can achieve better performance: averagely improve the bit accuracy by 5. 28\% and 5. 93\% against single and combined attacks, respectively, and show less file size increment and better visual quality.

item.title: Handling Data Heterogeneity via Architectural Design for Federated Visual Recognition
item.description: Our findings emphasize the importance of architectural design for computer vision tasks in practical scenarios, effectively narrowing the performance gap between federated and centralized learning.

item.title: Federated Learning of Large Language Models with Parameter-Efficient Prompt Tuning and Adaptive Optimization
item.description: This paper proposes a Parameter-efficient prompt Tuning approach with Adaptive Optimization, i. e., FedPepTAO, to enable efficient and effective FL of LLMs.

item.title: TeleQnA: A Benchmark Dataset to Assess Large Language Models Telecommunications Knowledge
item.description: Afterwards, using the provided dataset, an evaluation is conducted to assess the capabilities of LLMs, including GPT-3. 5 and GPT-4.

item.title: LINC: A Neurosymbolic Approach for Logical Reasoning by Combining Language Models with First-Order Logic Provers
item.description: Logical reasoning, i. e., deductively inferring the truth value of a conclusion from a set of premises, is an important task for artificial intelligence with wide potential impacts on science, mathematics, and society.

item.title: JointMatch: A Unified Approach for Diverse and Collaborative Pseudo-Labeling to Semi-Supervised Text Classification
item.description: However, existing approaches based on pseudo-labeling suffer from the issues of pseudo-label bias and error accumulation.

item.title: Universal Domain Adaptation for Robust Handling of Distributional Shifts in NLP
item.description: When deploying machine learning systems to the wild, it is highly desirable for them to effectively leverage prior knowledge to the unfamiliar domain while also firing alarms to anomalous inputs.

item.title: M2DF: Multi-grained Multi-curriculum Denoising Framework for Multimodal Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Therefore, in this work, we focus on whether the negative impact of noisy images can be reduced without modifying the data.

item.title: Rethinking Tokenizer and Decoder in Masked Graph Modeling for Molecules
item.description: Our results show that a subgraph-level tokenizer and a sufficiently expressive decoder with remask decoding have a large impact on the encoder's representation learning.

item.title: Extended Deep Adaptive Input Normalization for Preprocessing Time Series Data for Neural Networks
item.description: Data preprocessing is a crucial part of any machine learning pipeline, and it can have a significant impact on both performance and training efficiency.

item.title: Efficient Heterogeneous Graph Learning via Random Projection
item.description: To achieve low information loss, we introduce a Relation-wise Neighbor Collection component with an Even-odd Propagation Scheme, which aims to collect information from neighbors in a finer-grained way.

item.title: Continual Named Entity Recognition without Catastrophic Forgetting
item.description: This issue is intensified in CNER due to the consolidation of old entity types from previous steps into the non-entity type at each step, leading to what is known as the semantic shift problem of the non-entity type.

item.title: Multimodal Graph Learning for Modeling Emerging Pandemics with Big Data
item.description: This integration provides rich indicators of pandemic dynamics through learning with temporal graph neural networks.

item.title: FreeMask: Synthetic Images with Dense Annotations Make Stronger Segmentation Models
item.description: Then, we investigate the role of synthetic images by joint training with real images, or pre-training for real images.

item.title: Federated learning compression designed for lightweight communications
item.description: Federated Learning (FL) is a promising distributed method for edge-level machine learning, particularly for privacysensitive applications such as those in military and medical domains, where client data cannot be shared or transferred to a cloud computing server.

item.title: A Study on Knowledge Graph Embeddings and Graph Neural Networks for Web Of Things
item.description: Graph data structures are widely used to store relational information between several entities.

item.title: Assessing Step-by-Step Reasoning against Lexical Negation: A Case Study on Syllogism
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) take advantage of step-by-step reasoning instructions, e. g., chain-of-thought (CoT) prompting.

item.title: Tree of Clarifications: Answering Ambiguous Questions with Retrieval-Augmented Large Language Models
item.description: To cope with the challenge, we propose a novel framework, Tree of Clarifications (ToC): It recursively constructs a tree of disambiguations for the AQ -- via few-shot prompting leveraging external knowledge -- and uses it to generate a long-form answer.

item.title: Penalty Decoding: Well Suppress the Self-Reinforcement Effect in Open-Ended Text Generation
item.description: This paper investigates the self-reinforcement effect in text generation and the effectiveness of a repetition penalty to mitigate it.

item.title: Meta- (out-of-context) learning in neural networks
item.description: Brown et al. (2020) famously introduced the phenomenon of in-context learning in large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Series of Hessian-Vector Products for Tractable Saddle-Free Newton Optimisation of Neural Networks
item.description: A truncation of this infinite series provides a new optimisation algorithm which is scalable and comparable to other first- and second-order optimisation methods in both runtime and optimisation performance.

item.title: Towards LLM-driven Dialogue State Tracking
item.description: In this study, we conduct an initial examination of ChatGPT's capabilities in DST.

item.title: Fidelity-Enriched Contrastive Search: Reconciling the Faithfulness-Diversity Trade-Off in Text Generation
item.description: In this paper, we address the hallucination problem commonly found in natural language generation tasks.

item.title: Corruption-Robust Offline Reinforcement Learning with General Function Approximation
item.description: Notably, under the assumption of single policy coverage and the knowledge of $\zeta$, our proposed algorithm achieves a suboptimality bound that is worsened by an additive factor of $\mathcal O(\zeta \cdot (\text{CC}(\lambda,\hat{\mathcal F},\mathcal Z_n^H))^{1/2} (C(\hat{\mathcal F},\mu))^{-1/2} n^{-1})$ due to the corruption.

item.title: When Language Models Fall in Love: Animacy Processing in Transformer Language Models
item.description: However, we also show that even when presented with stories about atypically animate entities, such as a peanut in love, LMs adapt: they treat these entities as animate, though they do not adapt as well as humans.

item.title: CrisisMatch: Semi-Supervised Few-Shot Learning for Fine-Grained Disaster Tweet Classification
item.description: The shared real-time information about natural disasters on social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook plays a critical role in informing volunteers, emergency managers, and response organizations.

item.title: Key Frame Mechanism For Efficient Conformer Based End-to-end Speech Recognition
item.description: Following the initial encoder, we introduce an intermediate CTC loss function to compute the label frame, enabling us to extract the key frames and blank frames for KFSA.

item.title: Non-autoregressive Streaming Transformer for Simultaneous Translation
item.description: Simultaneous machine translation (SiMT) models are trained to strike a balance between latency and translation quality.

item.title: Rethinking Word-Level Auto-Completion in Computer-Aided Translation
item.description: Word-Level Auto-Completion (WLAC) plays a crucial role in Computer-Assisted Translation.

item.title: Linking Surface Facts to Large-Scale Knowledge Graphs
item.description: Open Information Extraction (OIE) methods extract facts from natural language text in the form of ("subject"; "relation"; "object") triples.

item.title: Learning spatio-temporal patterns with Neural Cellular Automata
item.description: Being able to learn arbitrary dynamics gives NCA great potential as a data driven modelling framework, especially for modelling biological pattern formation.

item.title: Beyond VaR and CVaR: Topological Risk Measures in Derivative Markets
item.description: This paper introduces a novel approach to financial risk assessment by incorporating topological data analysis (TDA), specifically cohomology groups, into the evaluation of derivatives portfolios.

item.title: On the Detection of Image-Scaling Attacks in Machine Learning
item.description: Unfortunately, this preprocessing step is vulnerable to so-called image-scaling attacks where an attacker makes unnoticeable changes to an image so that it becomes a new image after scaling.
